content: English addition to text of Anglo-Saxon Chronicle
summary: Part I, The Parker Chronicle and Laws (fols 1-56): a manuscript which may have been originally produced in Winchester, s. ix/x-xi1. The Manuscript was at Christ Church, Canterbury, by c. 1070.

notes.head: Hand
notes.body: The scribe of Domitian A. viii, s. xi/xii; a rounded hand, s. xii2; and nine annals are in a pointed hand, s. xii1 (Ker 1957, p. 59).

notes.head: Note
notes.body: A complete survey of the hands is given by Plummer 1952 and Thompson, and others, 1903-12.

admin: Manuscript described by Mary Swan and Owen Roberson, with reference to published scholarship (2010; 2013)
